message: Oh and why.. Blacking it Up because it's funny, political and well black. NPR Pop Culture because it's NPR voices saying things I find amusing, Nerdist for the awesomesauce interviews and Comic Racks because I love hearing talk about comic books and English accents.

I like listening to tech news so some of my favorite podcasts are Buzz Out Loud, This Is My Next Podcast and All About Android.  I also like fan podcasts about my favorite TV shows like Being Human Cast, Doctor Who: The Eleventh Hour Podcast and Sci-Fi Party Line.
Blacking it Up, NPR Pop Culture Happy Hour, Nerdist, Comic Racks are my tops
Depending on the guests I listen to Nerdist and TWiT most often.

@geekwhisperer I was so excited about the Nerdist interview with Matt Smith from Doctor Who.  But then Chris and his friend talked more than Matt did!  It turned me off in a big way.  I like a lot of podcasts on the TWIT network, too.
@dustdaughter Chris is a little overpowering. He needs a strong personality to create a good episode. The recent interview he did with Xeni Jardin from BoingBoing was really good.
@geekwhisperer Maybe I'll check that one out. But really, when you have a guest like Matt Smith, you really need to let him do the talking.

This makes me think of my biggest podcast pet peeves: 1) when all the hosts talk over each other; 2) when the host talks more than the guests; 3) when hosts talk about segues instead of *making* one.   @geekwhisperer
@dustdaughter Agreed again. Just because someone is in the position to do an interview, doesn't mean they are good at it.
